items.title: Senior Frontend Developer @ Fieldboom
items.content:
Senior Frontend Developer @ Fieldboom

2017-11-13 03:31

Description

A Bit About Us

  • First and foremost, we are advocates of small business owners - we know their struggles, we empathize with them and we want to help them grow their businesses
  • We’re building beautifully simple SaaS software to help them collect and analyze feedback that will help them grow their business using data, not guess work
  • We’re a remote team full of razor-sharp engineers, designers, content creators and marketers who love to learn and seek to continually get better
  • Our founder has a product/engineering/marketing background and has launched multiple companies which have generated 9-figures in combined revenue

A Bit About You (As A Person)

  • You are a learning machine - and rarely let a day go by where you don’t learn something
  • You know, like and agree with most of the views shared by the Basecamp guys
  • You value honesty, integrity and hard work immensely
  • You have hobbies outside of work and work doesn’t define you as a person
  • You want to join a team full of smart, creative people you will learn from
  • You’re looking for a career, not just another job

A Bit About You (Tech)

  • You have 2+ years of solid front-end dev experience working on large SPAs
  • You work well with back-end developers and have a good understanding of (and respect for) the relationship between product managers and engineers
  • You’ve been part of a remote team before or you’ve freelanced for at least 2 years

In terms of languages, frameworks, etc, here’s what we’re using right now - and what you’ll need excellent familiarity with to be a great fit for this role:

  • React
  • React DnD
  • Redux
  • Immutable.js
  • SCSS
  • Jest
  • Docker

What You’ll Do

  • Build out the front-end components that we’ll re-use as we’re building the product
  • Work closely with our other engineers to build new features that will help our customers collect, analyze and use feedback to grow their businesses
  • Fix front-end related bugs, performance issues, etc as they arise
  • Write highly readable, highly performance code that’s easy to pick up by other devs
  • Wear many hats - you know that’s the reality when you’re part of a small team

We Are For You If…

  • You want to learn from a founder who has launched multiple companies and see a job not just as a way to write code and get paid for it, but as a great learning opportunity
  • You value a team that works both hard and smart - who are obsessed with helping customers and honing their craft more than anything
  • You actually want to love your job, the people you work with and the software you help create, instead of simply tolerating them

Country

Anywhere*

Location

4 hour overlap with U.S. west coast required

items.title: Entry Level Full Stack Java Developer (Angular a plus) - FIS - Milwaukee, WI
items.content:
Entry Level Full Stack Java Developer (Angular a plus)
FIS -Milwaukee, WI 53223
FIS connects consumers to their money through leading-edge payments solutions. We’re the development engine of FIS: the largest, Fortune 500, Fintech company in the world. Our solution is branded by our customers — banks and retailers — so you might not have heard of us. But, if you’ve used a mobile banking app, interacted with an ATM, or used a debit card to complete a financial transaction, you’re most likely using FIS software. Our product is one that touches the average consumer on a regular basis, and makes the financial world go ‘round.

In this role, you would be a part of a brand new initiative at FIS. We are building a team of high performing, innovative and creative individuals to create a better experience for our clients. Since FIS is a company built on strategic acquisitions, this team will focus on making the applications that we have added to our portfolio over the years consistent in look and feel.

Our team is fast paced and fun. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career in our team means challenging yourself to always be better.

Position Description:

FIS is looking for an energetic individual to join us in building our next generation of web apps based on Angular 2+ and NodeJS; someone who will strive to meet the needs of our growing business. This individual will play a key role in analysis, design, development and implementation of Payment applications. This individual will work within an Agile team that works closely with other internal/external departments to ensure that the solution is meeting the needs of the business.

Responsibilities:
  • Work within an Agile team
    • To drive the design, development and implementation of technology solutions
    • Understand requirements, elicit feedback and refine solution through demonstrations
  • Participate in the entire SDLC and interface with Product Managers, clients, other IT partner and vendors in delivering solutions and troubleshooting technical issues during integration, migration of software components
  • Ensure designs are compliant with FIS Policies

Required Technical Skills:
  • Degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent experience
  • Professional, internship or academic experience in an Object Oriented Programming language such as Java, C++, C# or VB.NET
  • Professional, internship or academic experience in front end technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript
  • If experience is in another Object Oriented Programming language, must be willing to learn Java Programming

Required Soft Skills:
  • Strong communication skills
  • Detail-oriented, with excellent analytical and problem resolution skills
  • Passion for continuous improvement
  • Motivated to write quality, testable and readable code
  • Ability to thrive in a fast paced and dynamic environment
  • Drive to learn new technologies to keep FIS on the leading edge of web development
  • Although it will not be always be required, candidates must be willing to support teammates in providing 24x7 support as needed

Preferred Core Development Skills:
  • Experience in the following technologies is preferred:
    • Full stack web development: JavaScript, Angular (we prefer Angular 2.0+), HTML5, NodeJS, REST, JSON, CSS
    • Familiarity with development aiding tools (such as webpack, npm, yarn, etc.)
    • Java Programming
    • Soap and XML
    • Spring Framework
    • Unix
Other Preferred Skills:
  • Experience in using automated unit testing methods; preferably for Angular 2.0+ applications
  • Experience working with graphic designers and converting designs to visual elements
  • Experience in building reusable code and libraries for future use
  • Experience in optimizing applications for maximum speed and scalability
  • Experience in building applications that interact with APIs
  • Understanding differences between multiple delivery platforms (i.e., mobile, tablet, desktop) and optimizing output to match the specific platform
  • Experience in Secure Coding to prevent XSS, CSRF and other vulnerabilities
  • Experience with relational or nonrelational databases (such as SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle, MongoDB, Elastic)
  • Comfortable using Git for source code control
  • Experience with Agile Development methodologies
  • Familiarity with the Atlassian tool suite (JIRA and Confluence) preferred but not required
  • A DevOps mentality that understands using tools like Bamboo or Jenkins for Continuous Integration
  • Experience in payments or high transactional systems preferred but not required
  • Additional experience in working with remote team members a plus
**Current and future visa sponsorship not available for this position**

FIS™ is the world's largest global provider dedicated to financial technology solutions. FIS empowers the financial world with software, services, consulting and outsourcing solutions focused on retail and institutional banking, payments, asset and wealth management, risk and compliance, trade enablement, transaction processing and record-keeping. FIS’ more than 53,000 worldwide employees are passionate about moving our clients’ business forward. Headquartered in Jacksonville, Florida, FIS serves more than 20,000 clients in over 130 countries, and our technology powers billions of transactions annually that move over $9 trillion around the globe. FIS is a Fortune 500 company and is a member of Standard & Poor’s 500® Index.

.

FIS is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here: www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf and here: www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf

For positions located in the US, the conditions below apply. If you are made a conditional offer of employment, you will be required to undergo a drug test and background check (including criminal record check) ADA Disclaimer: In developing this job description care was taken to include all competencies needed to successfully perform in this position. However, for Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) purposes, the essential functions of the job may or may not have been described for purposes of ADA reasonable accommodation. All reasonable accommodation requests will be reviewed and evaluated on a case-by-case basis.

As part of the selection process this role may require an assessment to determine suitability

Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

    • Java Programming
    • Soap and XML
    • Spring Framework
    • Unix

  • Experience in using automated unit testing methods; preferably for Angular 2.0+ applications
  • Experience working with graphic designers and converting designs to visual elements
  • Experience in building reusable code and libraries for future use
  • Experience in optimizing applications for maximum speed and scalability
  • Experience in building applications that interact with APIs
  • Understanding differences between multiple delivery platforms (i.e., mobile, tablet, desktop) and optimizing output to match the specific platform
  • Experience in Secure Coding to prevent XSS, CSRF and other vulnerabilities
  • Experience with relational or nonrelational databases (such as SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle, MongoDB, Elastic)
  • Comfortable using Git for source code control
  • Experience with Agile Development methodologies
  • Familiarity with the Atlassian tool suite (JIRA and Confluence) preferred but not required
  • A DevOps mentality that understands using tools like Bamboo or Jenkins for Continuous Integration
  • Experience in payments or high transactional systems preferred but not required
  • Additional experience in working with remote team members a plus
**Current and future visa sponsorship not available for this position**

Our product is one that touches the average consumer on a regular basis, and makes the financial world go ‘round.

Since FIS is a company built on strategic acquisitions, this team will focus on making the applications that we have added to our portfolio over the years consistent in look and feel.

Our team is fast paced and fun. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career in our team means challenging yourself to always be better.

FIS is looking for an energetic individual to join us in building our next generation of web apps based on Angular 2+ and NodeJS; someone who will strive to meet the needs of our growing business.   • 3 years of experience in an Object Oriented Programming language such as Java, C++, C# or VB.NET

Required Soft Skills:

  • Detail-oriented, with excellent analytical and problem resolution skills
  • Passion for continuous improvement
  • Motivated to write quality, testable and readable code
  • Ability to thrive in a fast paced and dynamic environment
  • Drive to learn new technologies to keep FIS on the leading edge of web development
  • Although it will not be always be required, candidates must be willing to support teammates in providing 24x7 support as needed

    • Full stack web development: JavaScript, Angular (we prefer Angular 2.0+), HTML5, NodeJS, REST, JSON, CSS

    • Java Programming

    • Unix

items.title: ReactJS Front End Tech Lead
items.content: We're looking to hire a senior front end developer, with experience of, or interest in ReactJS to work mostly on new projects here in Cardiff. We're a fast growing tech startup, with a great work life balance and a real interest in helping you develop your career. items.title: Fieldboom: Senior Frontend Developer
items.content:
Senior Frontend Developer

Posted Nov 10

Fieldboom
Headquarters: Sydney
http://www.fieldboom.com

A Bit About Us

  • First and foremost, we are advocates of small business owners - we know their struggles, we empathize with them and we want to help them grow their businesses

  • We’re building beautifully simple SaaS software to help them collect and analyze feedback that will help them grow their business using data, not guess work

  • We’re a remote team full of razor-sharp engineers, designers, content creators and marketers who love to learn and seek to continually get better

  • Our founder has a product/engineering/marketing background and has launched multiple companies which have generated 9-figures in combined revenue

A Bit About You (As A Person)

  • You are a learning machine - and rarely let a day go by where you don’t learn something

  • You know, like and agree with most of the views shared by the Basecamp guys
  • You value honesty, integrity and hard work immensely

  • You have hobbies outside of work and work doesn’t define you as a person

  • You want to join a team full of smart, creative people you will learn from

  • You’re looking for a career, not just another job

A Bit About You (Tech)

  • You have 2+ years of solid front-end dev experience working on large SPAs

  • You work well with back-end developers and have a good understanding of (and respect for) the relationship between product managers and engineers

  • You’ve been part of a remote team before or you’ve freelanced for at least 2 years

In terms of languages, frameworks, etc, here’s what we’re using right now - and what you’ll need excellent familiarity with to be a great fit for this role:

  • React

  • React DnD

  • Redux

  • Immutable.js

  • SCSS

  • Jest

  • Docker

What You’ll Do

  • Build out the front-end components that we’ll re-use as we’re building the product

  • Work closely with our other engineers to build new features that will help our customers collect, analyze and use feedback to grow their businesses

  • Fix front-end related bugs, performance issues, etc as they arise

  • Write highly readable, highly performance code that’s easy to pick up by other devs

  • Wear many hats - you know that’s the reality when you’re part of a small team

We Are For You If…

  • You want to learn from a founder who has launched multiple companies and see a job not just as a way to write code and get paid for it, but as a great learning opportunity

  • You value a team that works both hard and smart - who are obsessed with helping customers and honing their craft more than anything

  • You actually want to love your job, the people you work with and the software you help create, instead of simply tolerating them

Please note: this is a full-time equivalent contract role for 40 hours per week.

Apply for this position

Please email the following to work@fieldboom.com: an overview of a front-end project you’ve worked on using React that you were the most proud of (what, specifically, did you do, who was in your team and what did you learn), a link to anywhere we can learn more about you (blog, web site, LinkedIn, Github, etc), a link to any live SaaS apps, etc that you've worked on as a frontend developer, the name of the best book you read in 2017 and why (can be non work-related).

  • Fix front-end related bugs, performance issues, etc as they arise

  • Write highly readable, highly performance code that’s easy to pick up by other devs

  • Wear many hats - you know that’s the reality when you’re part of a small team

We Are For You If…

  • You want to learn from a founder who has launched multiple companies and see a job not just as a way to write code and get paid for it, but as a great learning opportunity

  • You value a team that works both hard and smart - who are obsessed with helping customers and honing their craft more than anything

  • You actually want to love your job, the people you work with and the software you help create, instead of simply tolerating them

To apply: Please email the following to work@fieldboom.com: an overview of a front-end project you’ve worked on using React that you were the most proud of (what, specifically, did you do, who was in your team and what did you learn), a link to anywhere we can learn more about you (blog, web site, LinkedIn, Github, etc), a link to any live SaaS apps, etc that you've worked on as a frontend developer, the name of the best book you read in 2017 and why (can be non work-related).

items.title: Front-end Developer
items.content:
*We aren’t looking for a ‘Rock Star’ or a ‘Ninja’. We aren’t looking for a ‘Super Star Developer’ either. We want a team player; someone to help the team get things done in an environment that expects creativity and is obsessive about innovation. Be a rebel, but be part of our rebel alliance.*

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

_Essential_
* Expertise in JavaScript with a minimum of 2 years experience
* Layout and presentation skills in HTML, CSS and related technologies
* A thorough understanding of web concepts: HTTP, REST, web services, WebSockets, etc.
* Experience working on Agile projects, particularly Kanban or Scrum
* Working knowledge of coding best practices: version control, unit testing, CI and documentation
* Comfortable using the command line to support application development and deployment

_Desirable_
* Web application user interface design skills and experience
* Experience using Atlassian (Jira, Confluence, etc.) and AWS tools and services
* An understanding of application security and secure coding practices
* Demonstrable passion for working with Open standards / Open Source experience

RESPONSIBILITIES
* Develop solutions that meet the needs of users by considering the user at every step of the delivery process; from understanding the need to designing the solution and delivery
* Work as an integral member of a small and remote team
* Agree and deliver on sprint commitments
* Design and implement secure software components
* Participate in the iterative user needs analysis and design phases
* Ensure that code is well-tested in development and to take part in systems integration testing where required, to meet the agreed level of quality
* Participate in peer review processes
* Supporting the team through the full release cycle
* Participate in development support for the resolution of bugs, provision of hot fixes and support of the production system as required by application operations
* Supporting the test team where automation is necessary
* To follow and enhance the organisation’s software engineering practices and processes

items.title: Packlane: Software Engineer
items.content:
Software Engineer

Posted Nov 9

Packlane
Headquarters: Berkeley, CA
https://packlane.com

At Packlane, we help customers create impactful custom packaging – and we need you to create the powerful code that makes it all possible. In fact, we’d be OK with you wearing a brightly colored cape at your desk because you have X-ray vision for detecting bugs and a utility belt full of tools to eradicate them. As the ideal candidate, you understand that inventive and stable software is essential to the continued prosperity of our business — and also result in web experiences more forceful than a locomotive.

Consider Packlane a unique challenge - you’ll be in charge of code that allows people with a range of design knowledge (from novice to expert craftsman) to create a product that truly helps them tell their business’s brand story. It’s a big job, but the generalist engineer we’re looking for will be excited to work on a career-defining start-up that’s pioneering a new approach to designing and manufacturing packaging. Join our team as a software engineer and put your super-skills to work for good.

What You'll Do:
  • Ideate. Create. Innovate. Help our small (but ultra-productive!) team build new and wonderful products.
  • Craft the front end and back end of our web applications.
  • Build reliable systems in Elixir and Phoenix.
  • Design fabulous user experience with modern JavaScript standards (ECMAScript 2015 via Babel) and scale the front end with React.js and Redux.
  • Utilize unit testing in Elixir and Javascript with continuous integration to keep the bugs out.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders, department heads and consultants to provide the best user experience possible. 
  • Bend steel with your bare hands (optional).

What You'll Love About Packlane:
  • A chance to try new technologies - Packlane is an opportunity to cut your teeth on a novel technology stack, including innovative development frameworks and cutting-edge functional languages.
  • Support Modern Browsers - We’re living in the future and build for modern versions of Chrome, Firefox, Safari and IE. No IE8 here.  
  • We’re a small team - You’ll be one of few, which means you’ll have a real chance to make an impact. Expect (and hopefully enjoy!) a lot of control and influence over product decisions and prioritization.
  • You’ll help build our future - We’ve got a lot of ambitious projects in the works, from building manufacturing infrastructure from the ground up, to implementing robust order management systems that orchestrate an intricate production flow, and you’ll be at the forefront of it all.  
  • Flexibility - We’re an international team who appreciates the freedom to work remotely/from home when we need to, and we value getting everyone together in-person for the occasional company retreat. 

Requirements:
  • Mid level experience with Javascript and Elixir. You’ve built big projects in production and used both languages in anger. 
  • You’re excited by TDD and also know when perfectionism is the enemy of delivered.
  • An easy-to-work-with attitude, well-organized and highly self-motivated.
  • Reliable. Accountable. Dependable. And all the other good -ables. You know what they are.
  • Great communication and collaboration skills.
  • Strong work ethic and a healthy obsession with learning new things.
  • Familiarity with Git, NPM/Yarn, and AWS.

Bonus Points:
  • Pragmatic approaches to complex problems.
  • Capability and interest in championing best practices in React.js.
  • Functional programming advocates: who value immutability and functional purity.
  • Previous experience on remote teams.

Apply for this position

Apply @ https://packlane.workable.com/jobs/604507

items.title: Full Stack Software Engineer (Go/Javascript/HTML/CSS)
items.content:
*Full Stack Software Engineer (Go/Javascript/HTML/CSS)*

To us, being a Full Stack engineer is a mindset, you need to be competent in your core skills and excited to learn and try new things as and when you see a fit or need. No one wants to spread themselves too thinly and that is why we have carefully selected our few core technologies but we are not afraid of trying anything new that may be right for the job. If you agree with this then read on, it should hopefully mean that you are someone that likes to self improve.
This role is to be the first tech hire alongside Nub’s founder. You will be a key hire and valued highly if you can work hard as a team towards the aims of the company. Your judgement will be valued as we work towards engineering a unique multi-platform application with a web app based UI and a Go based back end.

*About you:*
- You are a dedicated and resourceful engineer
- 2+ years of professional Full Stack Software Engineering Experience
- Proven experience of completing HTML/CSS/Javascript deliverables (web app development not brochure style websites)
- Competence in Go (Golang) but if you have experience delivering software with another language (such as Python) and are keen to learn Go that may work.
- Competence writing SQL
- Happy to work with Node.js, Electron, ES6, Babel, Webpack.
- Exposure to Vuejs or similar (e.g. react)
- You love staying on top of the latest developments in software development
- Must be authorized to work in the UK
- Happy to work from home but meet in London for regular meetings.

*About Nub:*
Lego for written comms. Modular utility, ubiquity and unique accessibility.

Nub makes sending beautiful and personalised emails, invoices, forms, itineraries, receipts etc as easy as building with lego. Comprised of an engine and codeless tools to automate data capture, data manipulation and subsequent output primarily via email, pdf, print, data, or api. Triggered by any system, language or data and achieved without the need to be a programmer.

This kit will mean everyone can create cool customer communications on a new, automated, intuitive and scalable platform. It will allow anyone to handle data transformation and create automated output such as print, pdf or email. Have control over branding, designs customisation and personalisation.

Developers will love this because it removes a complex distraction from their applications. Companies large and small will love this because it will allow custom communications from any system to their employees or clients.
Anyone looking to automate data transformation from one format to the other will love this because they will find it a breeze to achieve.

*Why work for us?*
Nub is a new startup, the plan is to grow and become something every developer wants to use and every company choses to use... The CEO has a proven track record in this field and a forensic knowledge of the current technology and a clear vision of its potential.

You’ll get to work from home and help define our culture as the company grows. The plan is for a London office when the time is right. The CEO has a family, likes coffee, tech, would love a dog, used to race cars and loves sport.

You may want to exit the corporate world and enter into an exciting journey with an early stage startup. You may be bored of coding to someone else's spec, getting stuck in meetings and not being able to be creative with your code. Work at Nub and that will change.
Perhaps you are a brilliant coder looking for a great idea – this is it!

items.title: Senior Node.js / React Developer
items.content:
ManageFlitter – http://ManageFlitter.com – is a multi-award winning SaaS social media management product. ManageFlitter is used by over 3 million people around the world with paid customers from over 100 countries.

Our new product http://ManageSocial.com is well into development (we are very close to private alpha release). You can get a sneak peak of a very early version of ManageSocial here -> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W2oABEOCdpo&featur... 

This is a unique opportunity to work on an interesting greenfield project. Initially you will be working with 1 mid-weight engineer , 1 UI designer, and a tech lead to take this product from alpha to launch and beyond. You will also be working directly with the CEO.

ManageFlitter is headquartered in Sydney with team members in Canada, Brazil, Ukraine & Russia. We are approximately 50% remote based.

We believe Social Media is changing the world and we love being part of the change.

We are looking for someone with outstanding technical experience and a preference for working with a small smart team to work with us on our new ManageSocial product.

Whilst this is a remote friendly role our headquarters are based in Sydney Australia - time crossover is required with the team in Sydney and team members in other parts of the world. Depending on your location this may require you to time shift to some degree. 

Team is everything and we are proud of the great ManageFlitter and ManageSocial team that we have built. To ensure that the team remains of a very high standard we follow a fairly rigorous hiring process:

  • Initial 10-20 minute Skype chat.
  • Technical task: a custom designed technical task that allows us to gain insight into your approach to solving technical problems: 2-4 hours for someone familiar with our stack.
  • Technical interview: in depth technical chat based on your technical task: 1-2 hours.
  • Skype chat with 1-2 additional team members - 1 hour.


  • Impeccable English communication skills.
  • 5+ years experience building APIs preferably with Node.js, Express.js / Koa.js or similar.
  • Strong literacy with ES6 features and stay up to date with standards using babel.
  • Experience working with TDD including writing unit, integration & functional tests.
  • Experience working with BDD.
  • Experience delivering responsive UX/UI.
  • Understands Websockets and using Redis pub/sub model for real time communication with clients.
  • Previously worked on development of products using a SQL storage backend.
  • Experience building SPAs using React.
  • Experience working with AWS cloud services including Lambda.
  • Experience working with Postgres at scale.
  • Has built an application implementing the following:
    Redux
    Redux Sagas
    Reselect
    React Router
    ImmutableJS
    PostCSS
  • Experience working in an agile environment with a working knowledge of scrum and kanban workflows.
  • Relevant tertiary education.



BONUS SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

  • Product flair.
  • Strong working knowledge of the Twitter and Instagram API.
  • Experience writing technical specifications and documentation.
  • Has contributed to open source projects (provide examples if available).
  • Experience leading technical teams.
Our company culture is easygoing but hardworking. We believe in work-life balance but we also all enjoy being part of a fast moving focused and productive team.

We are committed to creating a culture where every team member can do their best work.

If the above sounds like a role you may be interested in please apply! We would love to hear from you.

To apply: Please apply at the following url:https://manageflitter.workable.com/jobs/544542

items.title: Ionic/Angular JS Developer @ Appnovation
items.content:
Ionic/Angular JS Developer @ Appnovation

2017-11-09 00:24

Description

About Us

Appnovation, a global technology enabled services provider, specializes in the design, development and integration of enterprise-grade open technology solutions. With 10 offices and 200+ employees, Appnovation delivers to clients ranging from startups to the Fortune 500, government entities and nonprofit organizations, helping them to identify opportunities for innovation and stay competitive.

To learn more about Appnovation’s projects, awards, or culture visit www.appnovation.com.

We are seeking an Ionic/Angular JS (experience with Angular 4 preferred) developer to deliver complex apps in Ionic and on our client's platforms. Alongside project delivery, you will maintain internal reference app that demonstrates the best of Ionic and its value proposition.

This role can be done remotely.

YOU WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO

  • Work on a number of hybrid mobile applications backed by an in-house component library to rapidly develop and deliver solutions
  • Work closely with product teams during the implementation of the mobile app
  • Work in a tight feedback loop with the product owners
  • Take requirements and make reusable / configurable components that can be used in component library.

WHO YOU ARE

  • Excellent written and verbal English
  • Confident when working with Product Owners and understanding their objectives
  • Proactive work chaser - not a “specification waiter”
  • Good experience working with remote teams
  • Experience working independently in an iterative delivery environments
  • Have an expectations setting mindset and be highly communicative
  • Be able to onboard quickly and work within team disciplines and constraints

Technical Skills required

  • Proven commercial Ionic/Angular JS development experience
  • Native or other hybrid mobile app development experience (Cordova/PhoneGap)
  • Proven commercial Ionic/Angular development experience using various flavours of JavaScript, specifically TypeScript, ES6 and ES2015
  • Excellent experience with REST APIs, JSON, NoSQL + data modelling
  • Excellent experience analyzing business and technical requirements
  • Automated testing framework experience
  • Mule/Cloudhub experience is a bonus
  • Experience with Janrain is a bonus

Thank you for your interest in a career with Appnovation Technologies!

Please note that only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Appnovation Technologies is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are treated equally.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: Front-end Developer @ UpMail
items.content:
Front-end Developer @ UpMail

2017-11-08 23:59

Description

UpMail is changing the way salespeople use emails. Our recommendation engine suggests users what to say and which content to share, making it easy and accessible for everyone to increase sales performance and generate more revenue.

We’re looking for a remote Front-End Developer to lead the front-end development of our B2B SaaS product, bring UpMail to the next level and shape the sales acceleration technology industry.

Founded two years ago by a CRM and Business Intelligence specialist, UpMail has an international team that includes passionate experts in Sales, Marketing, CRM and Tech who genuinely understand the challenges facing B2B sales people in today's digital world.

This opportunity comes at an exciting point in our journey: we’ve quickly grown our client base, which now includes well-known hotel groups like Hilton, Jury’s Inn, Virgin, and Best Western.

We’ve raised more than $500k in investment and just expanded from London with new offices in Paris and the US. Recently launched commercial partnerships in Central Europe and South-East Asia. We’re now getting ready for additional international growth and truly global expansion!

This is a unique occasion to make an important impact on a funded startup with a proven business model.

Current technology stack: Ruby on Rails, PostgreSql, JQuery.

Requirements

  • Minimum 3yrs experience in JavaScript (and HTML/CSS).
  • Experienced with React (or VueJS/Ember).
  • Competent working in the full stack (ideally Rails).
  • Experienced in automated testing.
  • Passionate working for a fast paced start-up experience.
  • "Get it done” attitude and background of delivering great work.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Minimum 4 hours time zone overlap with UK 9am-6pm.

Desirable

  • Strong UX understanding
  • Experienced working remotely

Benefits

  • Great and open-minded company culture built by an international team with global ambitions.
  • Incredible opportunity to create meaningful, scalable and successful tech company and progress internally as we grow.
  • Competitive salary and flexible hours.
  • Remote or based in our London office.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

Minimum 4 hours time zone overlap with UK 9am-6pm.

items.title: Front End Developer
items.content:
Front End Developer

Dojono is a FinTech startup based in Shoreditch, East London. With Private Equity backing, Dojono is well funded and on a mission to develop innovative and groundbreaking web experiences to change the way consumers interact with Financial Services online.

We're looking for talented, ambitious and competent individuals to join the already growing team. Someone not afraid to look at new methods and technologies to constantly improve and evolve the user experience.

You will be reporting to the CTO and based in the Shoreditch office 3 - 4 days per week, the rest of the week you'll be working remotely.

Necessary skills;
. Polymer - minimum 2 years experience.
. HTML5, CSS & SASS, Handlebars, node & npm - must be proficient.
. Git - Experience Git/Github user.
. Fluent understanding of the HTTP protocol.
. Must work on Mac or Linux.

Nice to have;
. Websockets
. Jenkins
. Linux
. Python
. Bash

A basic test will be set for all applicants, which can be completed off-site, before moving to the interview stage. The candidate needs to produce a Polymer (version 2) component to capture and validate a bank account and sort code against an API we will provide. They will then check this into a public Github repository on their account and share the details with us.

Salary: £30k - £35k

Start: immediately

items.title: JavaScript Developer
items.content:
About Toptal

Toptal is one of the most innovative and rapidly expanding tech start-ups from Silicon Valley. With backing from investors such as Andreessen Horowitz and Adam D’Angelo, our platform is the fastest growing labor marketplace in the history of the Internet—connecting thousands of elite engineers all over the world. In the last four years, Toptal has become the #1 choice for tech companies requiring top-tier engineering talent and for the top 3% of freelancers looking for their next challenge.

Position Description

We are looking for a JavaScript Developer motivated about combining the art of design with the art of programming. Your primary responsibility will be the implementation of visual elements and their behaviors with user interactions. You will work with both front-end and back-end web developers to build all client-side logic. You will also be bridging the gap between the visual elements and the server-side infrastructure, taking an active role on both sides, and defining how the application looks and functions.

By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.

Benefits:

  • Freedom to choose your own schedule and choose from a variety of hourly, part-time, and full-time projects.

  • The ability to work from wherever you want. Whether you prefer traveling and working from exotic beaches or spending time with your family and working from home, the choice is yours.

  • Access to a thriving, collaborative community of talented peers.

  • Invitations to frequent Toptal events going on around the world, including dinners, tech talks, conferences, and more.

  • Extremely competitive compensation.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop new user-facing features.

  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use.

  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs.

  • Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.

  • Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end services.

  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

Requirements:

  • Strong understanding of JavaScript, its quirks, and workarounds.

  • Basic understanding of web markup, including HTML5 and CSS3.

  • Good understanding of advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks such as AngularJS, Knockout.js, Backbone.js, React.js, DurandalJS, etc.

  • Experience with asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX.

  • Proficient knowledge of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around such issues.

  • Familiarity with JavaScript module loaders, such as Require.js and AMD.

  • Familiarity with front-end build tools, such as Grunt and Gulp.js.

  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git, Mercurial, or SVN.

  • Solid understanding of browser rendering behavior and performance.

  • Be willing to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them.

  • Be open to receiving feedback.

To apply: Please use the following link to apply: https://goo.gl/bKcoZW

10d

items.title: Technical lead
items.content:
Buildings are responsible for 40% of the world's energy footprint, and a typical building contains thousands of pieces of equipment, sensors, and interconnections. Gridium makes software that helps people run their buildings better, at lower cost and with less energy.

We are looking for someone to guide the engineering team creating the world’s best building operations tools. Someone who is passionate about developing industry-leading software using the most current tools and technologies. This is a role for a creative, collaborative technical leader excited to work in a small startup environment to help realize us realize our vision of an energy-efficient world.

About Gridium
Gridium is a growing, venture-backed SaaS software provider for buildings. Our products help commercial property owners manage all aspects of their buildings, from energy to work orders. We serve buildings of every shape and size, deploying a range of statistical and machine learning techniques to help develop energy efficiency strategies, streamline operations, and delight tenants.

We are a distributed company, so all employees work remotely. Remote work allows us to find great people wherever they happen to be, and it allows you to structure your day flexibly and with minimal interruption so that you can get stuff done in the style that makes most sense for you.

Of course, spending time face-to-face is important, so once a quarter we pick a city and meet up for several days of highly productive and highly fun planning and doing (and eating and recreating). Past trips include Austin, LA, Tahoe, Park City, Denver, LA, Chicago, and more.

We have a casual work environment where everyone's ideas and opinions matter. We are committed to work-life balance and offer everyone opportunities to learn, experiment, and grow. Since creative, enthusiastic employees are the basis for our success, we take great care and pride in how we attract, hire, and support our employees.

About the job
This is a job for someone who loves to build beautiful things. We use technologies like python, ember.js, java, R, and Amazon Web Services to drive our products. We need help bringing all of the pieces, including design, development, technical operations, and testing, into one cohesive package.

This job will also be hands-on across the entire stack. You will be asked to lead discussions and make important decisions that affect all Gridium products. This is a senior role for someone who enjoys taking ownership of complex products serving thousands of users.

  • Are you comfortable working in a remote environment?
  • Are you familiar with Amazon cloud services?
  • Are you comfortable working across the entire stack?
  • Are you eager to dig into complex technical topics?
  • Do you work well in collaborative team environments?
  • Do you want to truly own the products you work on?

If so, Gridium is the place for you.

Benefits
The position comes with salary, stock options, 401(k) match, a great health plan, vision, dental, generous parental leave, and a flexible vacation policy -- we want you to take the time off you need so that you are happy and productive.

And of course
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

To apply: Send a resume to jobs+techlead@gridium.com with subject 'Technical lead'.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer (Remote)
items.content:
HiringThing is looking for a senior software engineer to focus on building our next generation API.

Join a technology-first team dedicated to building the greatest recruiting software available. You’ll enjoy working on the latest web technologies in our ever-evolving stack and have significant input into product direction, technology decisions and development priorities.

You'll be leading the build of our new API, as well as helping to maintain our application, write automated tests, work with other developers remotely and deploy code to production regularly.

Requirements

Minimum 4 years of Ruby on Rails or a similar framework
Previous API development experience highly desirable
Experience with database-driven web applications (SQL)
Experience with HTML, CSS and JavaScript
Experience writing documentation for both internal and external developers
Independent work ethic
Strong communication skills
Technologies in Play

Ruby on Rails
MySQL
React
SCSS, Bootstrap
Amazon Web Services
Ubuntu Linux Server
About HiringThing

HiringThing is a cloud-based software company that helps companies post jobs online, manage applicants, and hire great employees. We’ve been in business since 2012 and are growing steadily.

We’re a fully remote company with a virtual office. We keep in touch with Slack and regular video conferences. You can work from home, a coffee shop or the beach as long as the work gets done.

We also offer competitive salaries and an Open PTO policy, in which each employee is afforded the flexibility to take vacation, take time off for illness and shift schedules as necessary

items.title: Javascript Developer
items.content:
We are looking for a Javascript developer to join our fast growing company, based in Cambridge, to help us build and improve our product that is used around the world.

Engineering is one of our core strengths. All our products are dynamic web apps, with a rich Javascript/React frontend built on top of a solid Python/Django backend. We are very agile, routinely running A/B tests and using feature toggles to release improvements. If you join us as a javascript developer, your code will be live in your first week.

You should have experience in building rich, dynamic web applications. You will have an interest in technology that is broader than your day-job, and will be able to discuss the architecture of larger projects you have been involved with.

You will be an excellent team player, who is comfortable discussing ideas with a group and who can highlight issues and risks in a constructive and helpful way. You will want to take responsibility for things, and we will give it to you. You take pride in what you produce and care about the people who use it.

**Company Overview**

10to8 provides a web-based online booking and appointment management system which is used worldwide by thousands of businesses, with a mission of ridding the world of wasted time.

Our product allows our clients to take bookings online, send automatic messages about bookings, and manage large numbers of appointments in a simple to use interface. You can try it out by signing up on https://10to8.com/

Our user base is growing rapidly and we are aiming to grow many times over in the next couple of years. Our clients range from sole traders (music & language teachers, beauticians) to medium sized businesses (Universities, charities, language schools). You can see what they think about us, take a look at our reviews: https://www.capterra.com/p/138962/10to8/

**Qualifications and Skills**

* Dynamic web app development (not brochure style websites)
* Javascript
* HTML5 & CSS3

**Bonus Points**

* React & Redux
* Performance optimisation
* Mobile-first web applications
* Python/Django

**Benefits**

* Competitive salary
* Company Pension
* 25 days holiday + bank holidays
* Personal development budget for training and career progression
* ideaSpace membership (https://www.ideaspace.cam.ac.uk/)
* Tax-free bicycle through the Cycle to Work Scheme (https://www.cyclescheme.co.uk/)
* Option to work from home up to 2 days per week
* Weekly social outings

items.title: React.js Front-end Developer
items.content:
Location: Remote, Europe
Job Type: Full Time
Start Date: Available immediately



Summary

DigitalMR is seeking a great JavaScript developer with proficiency in React.js. Your primary focus will be on developing user interface components and implementing them following well-known React.js workflows. You will ensure that these components and the overall application are robust and easy to maintain. You will coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and quality product is important.



The Company

DigitalMR is a high tech company in the space of market research and marketing. Following 4 years of focussed R&D in A.I. - financed by multiple government grants and self generated cash - we have developed a lot of unique I.P. some of which is patent pending. The main areas of our research are: text analytics - NLP, sentiment & semantic analysis, emotion detection and scoring, automated image theme and sentiment analysis. We work with blue-chip multinationals such as P&G, SABMiller, DIAGEO, Vodafone, Saxo Bank, YPO, Nielsen, TNS, and many more. We are already disrupting a 60 Billion US$ industry.



Requirements:

Having a great fit with the DigitalMR company values
Hands on experience and fluency in HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model
Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles
Experience with popular React.js workflows (such as Flux or Redux)
Familiarity with newer specifications of EcmaScript
Experience with data structure libraries (e.g. Immutable.js)
Familiarity with RESTful APIs
Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools
Experience with common front-end development tools such as Gulp, Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc.
Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
A knack for benchmarking and optimization
Familiarity with Git code versioning tool


Roles and Responsibilities:

­Maintaining existing and developing new user-facing features using React.js
Building reusable components and front-end libraries for future use
Translating designs and wireframes into high quality code
Optimizing components for maximum performance across a vast array of web-capable devices and browsers
Designing mobile-based features
Collaborating with back-end developers to improve usability
Building solutions for users and customers based on feedback
Helping back-end developers with coding and troubleshooting


Benefits:

­The successful candidate will have the opportunity to join a fast-growing, agile, and international team passionate about technology and innovation
­Flat structure, no bureaucracy, and lots of autonomy
­A competitive salary + bonus
Working from home

items.title: Backend Engineer
items.content:
*About Picked*

Recruitment is broken, we’re here to fix it. We're an ambitious new technology startup based in a lively workspace in Farringdon, and we’re looking for a backend engineer.

*Team*

We're a small team and we’ve just got started. This is our first backend role, so you’ll have an opportunity to shape the technology for the site.

The team have a lot of experience working with with the web and apps. Our hope is that you’ll be able to learn and try new things. You can read more about our team.

*Role*

This role is responsible for:

* Building the functionality of the site
* Collaborating with the frontend engineer to help each other’s work
* Setting up and managing tools for backend development
* Creating and managing the backend build process of deployment

*We’re looking for*

* Somebody that can balance trying new things with trying not to re-invent the wheel
* A love for attention to detail, but not getting drowned by it
* A willingness to hear out other, non-technical and technical members of the team
* A product-focused mind that’s prepared to do the hard work so the user doesn’t have to
* Priority-focused decision making

*Skills*

We’d love you to have:

* A great knowledge of at least one programming language
* Experience with an MVC framework such as Laravel, Rails, or Django. More than one would be great
* A strong desire to work in a test-driven environment
* Distributed version control knowledge

Even better if you have also:

* Have CI/CD experience
* Have some server knowledge

*Pay & benefits*

Salary starts at £40,000/pa, depending on experience and skills.

Our goal is to keep distractions to a minimum, do a good day’s work, and go home to rest.

* Choose your own equipment
* Activities throughout the week (yoga, pilates, football)
* 30 days of holiday, plus bank holidays
* Breakfast bar
* Snacks and beers on Fridays
* Flexible working

*Location*

Our office is in Farringdon, London, but with room to work from home.

*Apply*

Deadline is 10am on Friday, November 17th, 2017.

Get in touch with our technical director Thomas, attaching your CV and just briefly write about:

* What you’ve seen on this page that excites you
* A technical challenge you enjoyed figuring out
* Something you’ve seen recently that impressed you and why (doesn’t have to be technology!)

We’re not accepting applications from recruiters at this time.

*Process*

After each step of the process we’ll let you know if you’re successful or not, and will give feedback.

1. Review your application
2. A 30 minute telephone interview to talk about your experience
3. An onsite interview, typically an hour and a half, to chat about working in teams, technology, problem solving, with two exercises

*NB: Developer vs Engineer*

The reason for calling this role an ‘engineer’ is not because it’s trendy, but because we feel like this role is as much about building a website as setting up processes and using tools to make the whole system work.

items.title: Front-end Developer at Surevine (London, UK) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Collaboration Tools, Cybersecurity
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

We aren’t looking for a ‘Rock Star’ or a ‘Ninja’. We aren’t looking for a ‘Super Star Developer’ either. We want a team player; someone to help the team get things done in an environment that expects creativity and is obsessive about innovation. Be a rebel, but be part of our rebel alliance.

Skills and experience

Essential

  • Expertise in JavaScript with a minimum of 2 years experience
  • Layout and presentation skills in HTML, CSS and related technologies
  • A thorough understanding of web concepts: HTTP, REST, web services, WebSockets, etc.
  • Experience working on Agile projects, particularly Kanban or Scrum
  • Working knowledge of coding best practices: version control, unit testing, CI and documentation
  • Comfortable using the command line to support application development and deployment

Desirable

  • Web application user interface design skills and experience
  • Experience using Atlassian (Jira, Confluence, etc.) and AWS tools and services
  • An understanding of application security and secure coding practices
  • Demonstrable passion for working with Open standards / Open Source experience

Responsibilities

  • Develop solutions that meet the needs of users by considering the user at every step of the delivery process; from understanding the need to designing the solution and delivery
  • Work as an integral member of a small and remote team
  • Agree and deliver on sprint commitments
  • Design and implement secure software components
  • Participate in the iterative user needs analysis and design phases
  • Ensure that code is well-tested in development and to take part in systems integration testing where required, to meet the agreed level of quality
  • Participate in peer review processes
  • Supporting the team through the full release cycle
  • Participate in development support for the resolution of bugs, provision of hot fixes and support of the production system as required by application operations
  • Supporting the test team where automation is necessary
  • To follow and enhance the organisation’s software engineering practices and processes

About Surevine

Surevine builds secure, scalable collaboration solutions for the most security conscious organisations; joining people up and enabling collaboration on their most sensitive information. Our systems are accredited to handle the most sensitive information, whilst still delivering an intuitive and engaging user experience which actively promotes participation; building smart, secure networks of connected people. Our own smart research and development and customer sponsored R&D into collaboration technology delivers constant innovation, building products born out of genuine user needs.

Reasons to join

  • Opportunity to work amongst a team of exceptional developers working on and with the latest technologies
  • Be part of an agile, delivery-focussed team with daily stand-ups, fortnightly sprints, and retrospectives
  • Our belief in self-managed teams and reliance on self-motivated people
  • Our Director’s aren’t hidden away. They are accessible and involved. They are our co-workers
  • Chance to work in an fast-moving innovative environment with some tough problems for you to help us solve
  • Everyone is provided with a budget to kit out their workspace and make it cooler and more productive than they would ever get in a corporate cube
  • We don’t wear suits (often)

Benefits

Flexible working hours
Exceptional developers working on and with the latest technologies
Hubs for co-working
Generous budget to kit out your workspace (beats a corporate cube)
We don't wear suits
Agile, delivery-focussed team with daily stand-ups, sprints and retros
Beers on the Directors (if The Smiths are playing)
23+ days holiday
Shiny kit

items.title: Developers for healthcare software platform at CareEvolution (Ann Arbor, MI) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Industry: Health Care, Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Note: this job is open to US Residents only.  Foreign nationals can apply but only if you live within the US.

What we do actually matters. CareEvolution's HIEBus platform creates better patient outcomes.

Simply stated, we make web and mobile applications for healthcare. Under the covers, though, a lot more is going on - we have developed a robust software platform that ingresses data, programmatically links that data across institutions on a per-patient basis, and supplies APIs to consume, project, modify, and aggregate that data in all sorts of interesting and useful ways.  Please read our company page for a more detailed explanation of what we do and who we are.

We are looking for software people to help us:

  • build out our platform
  • write data adapters (drivers) to automatically ingress data from hundreds of data sources - in realtime
  • create the next generation of healthcare apps
  • identify the real needs of our customers, and execute on them accurately, quickly, and professionally

At CareEvolution, we don't tell you what to do. Part of the work at CareEvolution is determining what to do. We've designed our organization specifically to promote creativity, innovation, and focus on solving some of the most difficult problems in healthcare.

Visit http://letsfixhealthcare.com to learn more - or contact us (resume@careevolution.com) - and we'll explain what CareEvolution is all about.

Skills & Requirements

Must haves

  • A real passion for solving problems in healthcare
  • High programming expertise
    • expert knowledge of object-oriented design and design patterns.
  • Solid relational database chops
  • A willingness and ability to actively help define the scope of our work
  • The ability and interest to learn many different things - and teach others
  • Strategic thinking
    • In terms of helping us be competitive in the marketplace, yes - but more importantly, strategic in helping us deliver on our mission of creating better patient outcomes.  We're serious about this.

Nice-to-haves

  • Expertise with one or more of the following
    • ASP.NET
    • MVC
    • MS SQL Server
      • General (light) DBA-type competencies (rebuilding indexes, etc.)
      • Debugging queries, diagnostics with execution plans, SQL Profiler, etc.
    • Python
    • JS including common frameworks like Angular, React, Ember
    • Data science/ML
    • WCF
    • AWS/EC2
  • ETL
    • Lots of experience writing tools and services that process a variety of different data formats; preferably clinical formats, but if you have experience in dealing with lots of different formats and have been in the trenches of gnarly data integration exercises - we're very interested in talking to you.
  • Clinical IT expertise, including one or more of the following:
    • HL7
    • Claims formats
    • IHE profiles
    • CCDs
    • EMRs/EHRs
  • 2+ years of experience writing and maintaining automated UI or end-to-end tests using tools such as Selenium a strong plus
  • iOS
  • EC2 configuration and administration
  • Interest in and ability to interact with clients as design partners
  • DevOps

About CareEvolution

CareEvolution is an Ann Arbor, Michigan-based provider of Health Information Exchange (HIE) software platforms and applications. Our software allows healthcare providers and patients to make better decisions faster. We're looking for talented software engineers to join our team in solving some of the most difficult problems in HIE.

CareEvolution's stack has been selected as the technical infrastructure for seven statewide exchanges in the US. We also have other large public and private exchange networks, as well as health plan exchanges in active deployment.

Our team is quite small, but all of us are technical people. We maintain a strong start-up/hacker culture. CareEvolution has partnered with a few large companies with relationships in all 50 states - and beyond - to supply a large portion of our sales and marketing efforts.  Our stack is recognized by leading HIE industry analysts as the most technologically sophisticated HIE on the market - by a significant margin.  Mention the word sesquipedalian in your employment application to have it processed quickly. 

We are focused and execute very quickly. But we also have a lot of fun - biweekly visits to the bar, daily ping pong/foosball/darts games in the office, hackathons every eight weeks for pet projects, biannual company-wide get-togethers, board game nights, rock climbing nights, disc golf days... etc. We are also a very family-friendly organization. We have constant, active teleconference for all of our remote employees (all remote people must live somewhere in the US or Canada) - which comprise more than half of the CareEvolution team.

Check out our company page to the right, and visit http://letsfixhealthcare.com for more information on what we do.

Benefits

Management-less environment
Work from anywhere
Competitive Salary
401K & Defined Benefit
Strong Partnerships
Flex Time
Hackathons every 8 weeks
Talented coworkers
Biweekly post-work get-togethers
This work actually matters

items.title: Co-Founder Exec/Leader + Hands-on Front-End Web Developer w/Designer's Eye at Scribl.com (Scribliotech, Inc.) (Hanover, NH) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Marketing, Publishing

Job description

Join us and become a part of history as together we change the face of e-commerce for digital content and preserve the ability of authors to earn a living writing. We are looking for a smart, creative front web developer with a strong design sense to complement the existing team. 

This role will complement the rest of the founding team who has already built the back-end infrastructure and first beta version of the website. As we prepare to come out of beta and traffic is climbing, we now need an updated UI to match.

The current beta site has been developed in Ruby-on-Rails. We are migrating the core code to Elixir / Phoenix. We're looking to move to a ReactJS front end for the main UI, sporting responsive design and to share code with our parallel React Native app development efforts.

Highlights

  • Get in on the ground floor and become an owner of a new, industry-transforming company.
  • Consult with former kayak.com founding employee & Chief Architect Bill O'Donnell, who is a technical advisor to the company.
  • Create your own solutions to challenging technical problems.
  • Choose the tools that will be used by you and your colleagues.
  • Lead and build the look and feel of an upcoming major e-commerce site.
  • Make mistakes, disrupt the status quo, and help us create the engineering culture that you would like -- build your own dream job!

If hired, you will receive a hefty equity grant relative to the position. You will also earn direct payment in the form of a revenue share on every dollar in revenue we generate directly and across our  1,000+ distribution partners. Your pay will increase as our gross revenue increases, until those rev-share pay levels reach your target salary.

We are located in the growing Lebanon/Hanover, NH tech region around Dartmouth and the Lebanon airport, but during our launch phase, we expect candidates to work from home, wherever that may be. We will pay for relocation, should that become necessary in the future.

Part Time / Full Time

We're looking for someone who ultimately wants a full time position with us, but if you need a transitional period working for Scribl part time while you continue to do other work, we fully support that. 

Skills & Requirements

NOTE: Your cover letter matters to us, maybe more than your resume! We want to know why you are interested in Scribl. Please read this section and write it accordingly.

We want you if you are:

  • Fun, kind, fast, and flexible
  • A good communicator
  • Possessed of a strong sense for minimalist and elegant design, with a dash of fun
  • Passionate about digital content, especially ebooks and audiobooks

And have strong technical experience with:

  • ReactJS (or other deep JavaScript experience)
  • HTML5 and Responsive Design
  • SEO
  • Writing high-quality, testable, and maintainable JS code
  • E-commerce and security best practices
  • Adobe or other graphic design tools to support your UI work

If you have some experience with these, that's a plus, but it's not required:

  • Ruby-on-Rails or Elixir/Phoenix to work with our existing system and back-end
  • Familiarity with AWS hosting and OpsWorks
  • NGINX, Linux Ubuntu, and Docker 
  • Full-stack capabilities
  • Media presentation of EPUB and stream audio
  • Podcasting
  • Mobile and Windows UWP development in React Native or Xamarin
  • Strong team-building and project management record
  • Leadership

You will be responsible to:

  • Work on your own and with other developers who are adding capabilities on the back-end and developing mobile apps to accompany our ebook and audiobook store
  • Build and support tight integration between the front end UI, our backend database, and our apps so the user experience is preserved regardless of how the user accesses our content
  • Nurture a healthy engineering culture

It is important that you either have or are willing to gain an appreciation for digital content creators -- authors and artists. Our success is dependent on our ability to help them prosper and want that perspective to be shared by everyone on our team. Please describe your interest in Scribl, CrowdPricing, ebooks, or authors in your cover letter. The resume should show you have the skills. The cover letter is what tells us why you may be the right person for the position.

About Scribl.com (Scribliotech, Inc.)

We are Scribl (Scribliotech, Inc.), a unique self-publishing partner for authors, developers, and artists. We exist to provide those content creators with ever improving means to promote and sell their creative work to interested customers and for those customers to easily find and acquire for a fair price the works that will be most appealing to them.

You can see the current beta version of the site at http://www.scribl.com. With domestic and international patents pending and an impressive and growing partner list, we have developed an entirely new and disruptive CrowdPricing(TM) system for digital content. We believe our CrowdPricing and distribution system will become the digital content model of the next decade, better addressing the interests of consumers, authors/developers, and distributors than any other current system.

Benefits

items.title: Senior Front-End Engineer, JavaScript + .NET at Olo (New York, NY) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: E-Commerce, Mobile, Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

At Olo we develop an online food ordering platform used by many of the country’s largest restaurant chains, reaching millions of consumers. We take pride in a neat codebase with automated tests and continuous integration, and encourage constant refactoring. We encourage new ideas and experimentation. No part of the code base is off limits.

Our current technologies include modern versions of Ember, React, TypeScript, ASP.NET MVC, C#, and F#. We also rely on tools such as AWS, GitHub, TeamCity, Octopus Deploy, Sumo Logic, Datadog, and New Relic. We don’t expect you to have experience with everything in this list, and we’ll help you learn what you don’t know!

As a front-end engineer at Olo, you will play a significant and visible role in helping us build one of the most advanced food ordering platforms in the hospitality industry. You will help us shape the digital guest experience for restaurant brands served by Olo. You will contribute to technology selection, architecture and user experience for our front-end applications.

Any engineer may work at Olo’s headquarters in New York City’s Financial District or remotely from anywhere in the U.S. In fact, more than half of our engineering team is remote!

Requirements

  • Experience building user interfaces that put users first and look and feel awesome to use
  • Deep knowledge of ES6/ES2015+ and one or more modern Javascript frameworks, with a preference for React or Ember
  • Demonstrable understanding of the full .NET web stack
  • Leadership experience that spans one or more aspects of technology selection, architecture and design oversight, and mentoring others
  • Superb problem solving skills with an emphasis on pragmatism, quality, and performance
  • Passion for learning new skills and technologies
  • Excellent collaboration skills
  • BS degree in a technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience
  • Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English
  • Legal right to work in the U.S

About Olo

Olo reaches millions of consumers by powering mobile and online ordering for many of the country’s largest restaurant chains. Mobile ordering and payments is an exciting and active industry full of interesting players and yet still a relatively untapped market ripe for disruption.

We’re quite up-front about the technical challenges our business faces. Running a platform with multiple white-labeled front-ends, that maintains real-time connections into thousands of restaurants’ POS systems, and coordinates complex transactions between these and other third parties (such as payment gateways and gift card providers) is not for the faint of heart!

Olo is located at 26 Broadway in the historic Standard Oil Building, the former home of John D. Rockefeller.  We offer great benefits, such as 20 days of Paid Time Off, fully paid health, dental and vision care premiums, stock options, a generous parental leave plan, and perks like FitBits, rotating craft beers on tap in our kitchen, and food events featuring our clients' menu items (now you know why we give out FitBits!). Check out our culture map.

Olo is an equal opportunity employer and diversity is valued at our company. All applicants receive consideration for employment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Benefits

20 Days of PTO
Semi-private offices
Health, Vision & Dental coverage (you + your family)
Flexible working hours
Competitive Compensation Package
Powerful workstations
401(k) Plan
Maximum respect
Food events & monthly team events
12 week paid parental leave

items.title: Intermediate/Senior Software QA Engineer at Daily Kos (Kos Media LLC) (Oakland, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: QA/Test Developer
Industry: Digital Media
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

We are seeking an experienced QA lead to shape the QA function at Daily Kos. Currently most QA at Daily Kos is done manually and the responsibility is spread across a few people on staff who also have other roles. This QA Engineer will be the first dedicated hire for QA and will have a significant role in shaping the department as we expand our development team and build out more capacity for automated testing. Applicants should be self-sufficient and comfortable working independently. In addition we are looking for someone who:

  • can clearly and precisely document bugs and the steps to reproduce them
  • can write and follow detailed test plans for new features
  • can use the JavaScript console, debugger, and other browser developer tools
  • can write and run raw SQL queries in MySQL or PostgreSQL; knowledge of other data storage a plus
  • can read Ruby and JavaScript code 
  • has awareness of typical programming errors and the unexpected things users do whether accidentally or maliciously
  • has exposure to performance and security testing
  • has exposure to front-end automated testing tools
  • can summon a maddeningly creative approach to breaking things and other chaos monkey skills
  • enjoys using the Daily Kos application in general
  • will advocate for our users both internally and externally to ensure they have the reliable tools that they need and do what they need and expect

At Daily Kos, we believe that the diversity of ideas, experiences and cultures that our employees contribute to our organization help us be more effective in our work, and we are proud to be an inclusive and equal-opportunity workplace. We're a company that loves learning and supports growth and training for all our employees.

To apply, please send an email to tech_jobs@dailykos.com with the name of the position in the subject line, a cover letter, code sample or github repo and your resume (include your LinkedIn profile link).

About Daily Kos (Kos Media LLC)

DailyKos, the leading online progressive blogging and activism platform, is looking for an Intermediate/Senior Software QA Engineer.

DailyKos is a great place to work-- your code will be used by hundreds of thousands of people a day who care deeply about progressive politics and are working to effect real political change. We provide an extensive feature set that extends from blogging to activism and beyond. If you want a job that provides more than just a technical challenge, we'd love to hear from you.

The job offers a flexible work environment, the ability to work remotely (US only, please) on a distributed team of self-sufficient collaborators, competitive salary and benefits, and we provide an Apple MacBook Pro or your preferred comparable hardware. Our organization’s commitment to personal growth reduces churn and encourages a very rewarding long term position. We have an energized team filled with great people with different backgrounds.

Benefits

100% Medical Coverage
6 weeks paid vacation per year
401K Plan

About Forward Financing

- Boston-based fintech company, 100% focused on efficiently providing capital to US-based small and medium sized businesses- 40 full time employees based in downtown Boston (~90 ppl company worldwide)- 15th fastest growing company in US & #1 in Massachusetts (Inc 500)- 2nd fastest growing company in Massachusetts (BBJ's 2017 Fast 50)- We've funded over 4,000 unique businesses on our platform since being founded in 2012 (probably the most of any fintech player in Boston)- Our platform reviews over 5,000 business applicants a month using our proprietary technology; we provide over $100 million a year to these SMBs on our platform- Raised over $30m in financing since inception; Company is profitable
