items.title: FullStack Developer (Must be based in Europe) at Kodify.io () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Entertainment
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

The team at Kodify is looking for a talented FullStack Developer to join our remote team. This specific role is open to remote candidates based in European Union only (a must for us). With you on board, we’re looking to expand our team (currently 7 developers working across multiple European locations) and take our projects to a whole new level. You will deliver Javascript development skills on the front and backend systems that power our sites. Good knowledge of HTML and CSS are also required, along with the ability to work with our designers and the business to implement the features required.

Your key responsibilities: 

  • Create Server and Client JS, HTML & CSS to deliver required functionality and design
  • Highly skilled in frontend templating engine using React
  • Ensure all code is modular, and where possible developed as reusable
  • End-to-end responsibility from technical design to deployment and testing
  • Work with Designers & Product Owners to ensure they understand possibilities / limitations
  • Always work towards minimising page load time & data transferred
  • Become a valued team member, providing feedback to the team
  • Take ownership of your code / tasks / role
  • Be proud of what you achieve, and of the product, and be one of the driving forces behind always making it better
  • When you cock-up - own-up! (We don’t do blame-storming here!)
  • Have fun and enjoy your job!

About you:

  • You’re a real team player. You love to help and find solutions together.
  • Your sense of humour will bring a new dynamic to the team - you love to have fun while you work!
  • You can think on your feet and adapt well to fast changing environments and priorities.
  • You are passionate about software development
  • You're able to think beyond code to architecture and user experience
  • You have a a real ‘Can Do’ work ethic - We are results based, not clock based!

Skills & Requirements

Must Have:

  • NodeJS
  • Javascript / HTML / CSS
  • React
  • MongoDB
  • Github
  • LESS / SASS
  • Bootstrap and JQuery

Bonus points:

  • Express / Connect
  • Redis
  • RequireJS
  • ZeroMQ
  • TDD
  • BusterJS / CucumberJS with WebdriverIO
  • Your own open source projects
  • DataTables
  • High traffic web sites
  • Linux
  • AWS Technologies (e.g. EC2, S3, Cloudformation, ..)
  • Chef
  • Streaming video technologies / Web playback tools (VideoJS)
  • Understanding of, and agreement with, Agile principles
  • Knowledge and experience in Git and JIRA

Other:

  • Experience working remotely and with remote teams
  • Experience managing high traffic and content heavy websites.

Education is compulsory, but where you got it is irrelevant for us! We are looking for someone who has worked in a similar role (or roles) for at least 3 years, and can show us examples of their work. We are not looking for a newbie, nor are we looking for a rockstar, we are looking for a mid to senior level developer who wants to both learn and contribute to our team.

Do you like what you read and want to be part of it? Please send us your CV along with a covering letter explaining why this job is right for you, and why you are right for the job!

About Kodify.io

Kodify just passed its 5th year anniversary but we're based on years of success, building and managing high-traffic websites. We have grown our websites to 6M visitors per day which comes with a challenging set of technical problems to overcome. Our success is down to Kodify’s teamwork, where each one of us plays a key role in getting us one step closer to our goals. All of this doesn’t happen without a healthy portion of fun & perks! From company BBQs on our fantastic terrace, to yearly company off-sites, we make sure sure to live by our motto “Work Hard, Play Harder” and balance it all out! It’s our goal to create one of the best working environments possible which allows everyone to grow and achieve their maximum potential with their individual skill sets.

What’s on offer:

  • Core hours with flexitime: work when you’re at your most creative!
  • Training and development budget and free days to attend training/conferences/etc.
  • Latest tech equipment: choose whatever boosts your productivity!
  • Agile environment
  • 10% time for personal projects
  • Free afternoons on Fridays
  • Company Amazon book account
  • Half Day off on your Birthday
  • Awesome offices and locations: Barcelona, Altea and Montreal!
  • Kodify off-sites, events and team activities!
  • Unique Kodify culture!

Benefits

Competitive salary
10% time for personal projects
Private health insurance
Core hours with Flexitime
Brand new equipment on joining
Learning and development budget
Free lunches
Yearly 3 day company off-sites
Free snacks, drinks and lots of team activities!
Amazing offices in: Barcelona, Altea and Montreal!

items.title: Front-end Developer
items.content:
Front-end Developer - Jobmote

Front-end Developer

X-Team

About X-Team

“Motivated developers, ready to join your team.”

X-Team is an international company founded in Melbourne, Australia that helps companies scale their development teams by providing them with extraordinary developers from around the world.

We are 100% remote and believe in building a world where developers can have access to an environment of growth and incredible opportunities regardless of where they live. Our culture is based around the proactive, selfless values that make up every X-Teamer.

We are a community of people dedicated to unleashing our potential every day. Learn more about how we can help you learn and grow at https://x-team.com/unleash/

 

About You:

The right individual will be self-driven. Someone who cares about maintainability of the code, automation, deployment processes and how to enable innovation through fostering a growing culture of Open Source. You will go beyond just coding and help to shape the engineering culture and best practices.

 

Most important:

  • Experience with React and/or Angular

  • Experience with SASS, Webpack

  • Ability to build and improve a REST/JSON API client

  • Ability to debug API responses

  • Write high-performance, reusable code for UI components

 

Nice to have:

  • Experience with working remotely

  • Familiar/involved with open­ source projects

 

Personal:

  • Independent, self-motivated

  • Fluent in English, written and spoken

  • Proven track record of always learning and growing.

  • Proactive attitude

  • Possess a spirit of generosity

 

Perks:

  • Get the chance to work with big brands like Riot Games, Fox Broadcasting, Kaplan Inc., etc.

  • Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses (X-Outposts) around the world.

  • Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads.

  • Join our vibrant community, filled with opportunities to join engaging engineering roundtable discussions, AMAs, gaming clubs, LAN parties, charitable fundraisers, fitness programs (+gym membership), etc. This is the community to be in if you’re a remote developer.

  • We’ll provide up to $2,500 in funding for your learning and growth each day through our Unleash program, which provides opportunities to unleash your potential through initiatives that help you grow as a developer and explore your passions more. (http://x-team.com/unleash)

 

FAQ :

Who is X-Team meant for?

  • Any freelance developers with experience working on high-scale, remote teams and projects with a motivated, proactive attitude and compassionate, team-player heart. If you’ve worked with freelancing platforms before, that’s not what we are. X-Team is a community of all likeminded people, carefully chosen to ensure we are able to create an environment of the most motivated people in the world who come together to unleash their potential. What we’ve created is truly special and not a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together, while becoming more motivated than they’ve ever been.

 

What are you hiring for right now?

  • We are hiring for Front-end developers to fill some exciting new opportunities we have. We’re also hiring for a variety of other skills, such as React, React Native, Cryptocurrency/blockchain, Node.js, Salesforce, DevOps, and Golang.

 

Will I get a job immediately after applying?

  • If your skills, experience and values align with a current opening we have, your chances of getting hired immediately are high. If we discover you’re qualified but all opportunities have been taken, we’ll continue to work with you to help you get a role in X-Team. The key is having the most relevant, in-demand skills when you apply.

 

What kind of opportunities do you provide?

  • We provide full-time opportunities that last, on average, for 10 months. After your role ends (and so long as you’ve performed well), we continue to give you work internally with us until we find you a new opportunity. This ensures that X-Team can be a stable work option for you as a freelancer.

items.title: Front end Developer
items.content:
MUST BE BASED IN UK


We aren’t looking for a ‘Rock Star’ or a ‘Ninja’. We aren’t looking for a ‘Super Star Developer’ either. We want a team player; someone to help the team get things done in an environment that expects creativity and is obsessive about innovation. Be a rebel, but be part of our rebel alliance.


Skills and experience


Essential



  • Expertise in JavaScript with a minimum of 2 years experience

  • Layout and presentation skills in HTML, CSS and related technologies

  • A thorough understanding of web concepts: HTTP, REST, web services, WebSockets, etc.

  • Experience working on Agile projects, particularly Kanban or Scrum

  • Working knowledge of coding best practices: version control, unit testing, CI and documentation

  • Comfortable using the command line to support application development and deployment


Desirable



  • Web application user interface design skills and experience

  • Experience using Atlassian (Jira, Confluence, etc.) and AWS tools and services

  • An understanding of application security and secure coding practices

  • Demonstrable passion for working with Open standards / Open Source experience


Responsibilities



  • Develop solutions that meet the needs of users by considering the user at every step of the delivery process; from understanding the need to designing the solution and delivery

  • Work as an integral member of a small and remote team

  • Agree and deliver on sprint commitments

  • Design and implement secure software components

  • Participate in the iterative user needs analysis and design phases

  • Ensure that code is well-tested in development and to take part in systems integration testing where required, to meet the agreed level of quality

  • Participate in peer review processes

  • Supporting the team through the full release cycle

  • Participate in development support for the resolution of bugs, provision of hot fixes and support of the production system as required by application operations

  • Supporting the test team where automation is necessary

  • To follow and enhance the organisation’s software engineering practices and processes

items.title: Senior​ ​Mobile​ ​App​ ​Developer @ Outcomes4Me
items.content:
Senior Mobile App Developer @ Outcomes4Me

2017-11-03 02:27

Description

At Outcomes4Me, we are building an integrated platform which provides patients and theirfamilies with new ways to engage with healthcare systems globally. Our goal is to help themseamlessly discover and access personalized treatment options and outcomes information.

We recognize that the efficacy of personalized health apps is a huge issue for a relatively newsector. Increasingly, design, tech and healthcare need to work together to prove that newproducts and techniques – driven by developments in mobile – can be effective. We are verymuch aware of these issues and are bringing together a diverse and multi-disciplinary team toaddress these challenges.

We are looking for a highly experienced app developer to join our team full-time to help uscreate lasting and meaningful mobile experiences on our digital health platform.

What you have:

  • Extensive experience developing for mobile platforms
  • Fluent with modern Javascript stack: React, React Native, Flow, TypeScript, GraphQL
  • Experience with server-side development (particularly Node.js)
  • Familiarity with Agile methodologies, such as Scrum / Kanban
  • Comfortable owning the app development process from design to deployment, workingclosely with product designer and manager to deliver a successful, highly polished product
  • Prior experience with either Objective-C or Swift is a plus
  • Comfortable working at a startup pace and in a rapidly changing environment

What you will do:

  • Develop and implement user-facing mobile experience and product features
  • Work alongside design and product leads to define, prioritize and develop new productfeatures
  • Work with backend teams to integrate the app with purpose built APIs
  • Own mobile app development and deliver polished working product

If you’re interested in applying technology to make healthcare better and have relevant skillsand experience, please send your resume to jobs@outcomes4me.com . We offer competitivecompensation and benefit packages, and for the right skillsets are open to remote workingconfigurations.

Country

Anywhere

items.title: UI Engineer @ Ambra Health
items.content:
UI Engineer @ Ambra Health

2017-11-03 02:00

Description

Ambra Health, a healthcare technology SaaS, is looking for a JavaScript developer to maintain and enhance Ambra Health’s front-end medical image sharing web application. You will report to the Director of Web Engineering. Familiarity with modern front-end web development is essential. The ideal candidate would be able to work independently with minimal supervision and be enthusiastic about keeping up-to-date with the latest web technologies. The virtual team is distributed, with team members working remotely in Boston, New York, Denver, San Antonio, and Phoenix.

Required:

  • JavaScript, HTML5, CSS
  • JQuery, Underscore
  • Working knowledge of Linux

Familiarity with any of the following would be a big plus:

  • Mustache
  • Gulp
  • DICOM
  • Selenium/Nightwatch or other web UI testing frameworks

Position Responsibilities

  • Plan, evaluate, implement, test and document new features and bug fixes for the Ambra Health web application
  • Work with other development team members to integrate with backend services
  • Work with DevOps to deploy code into our production and UAT environments
  • Work with customers and professional services to gather requirements
  • Conform to company standard operating procedures

What qualifies you to join?

  • A combination of a college degree in CS, Math or related, relevant work experience, and/or a strong open source portfolio
  • General interest in the healthcare field
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Meticulous attention to detail with strong organization skills
  • Base salary and stock options depend on experience; health insurance, paid holidays and vacation are part of the package.

Country

Anywhere

What we've created is truly special and not a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together, while becoming more motivated than they've ever been.

  • We are hiring for PHP developers to fill some exciting new opportunities we have. We're also hiring for a variety of other skills, such as React, React Native, Cryptocurrency/blockchain, Node.js, Salesforce, DevOps, and Golang.

    Will I get a job immediately after applying?

  • If your skills, experience and values align with a current opening we have, your chances of getting hired immediately are high. If we discover you're qualified but all opportunities have been taken, we'll continue to work with you to help you get a role in X-Team. The key is having the most relevant, in-demand skills when you apply.

    What kind of opportunities do you provide?

  • We provide full-time opportunities that last, on average, for 10 months. After your role ends (and so long as you've performed well), we continue to give you work internally with us until we find you a new opportunity. This ensures that X-Team can be a stable work option for you as a freelancer.

items.title: Demio: Senior Full Stack Developer (Exciting Startup 😄)
items.content:
Senior Full Stack Developer (Exciting Startup )

Posted Nov 1

Demio
Headquarters: We're Remote :D
https://demio.com

Welcome! We’re excited to add a new Senior Full Stack Engineer to our team, but not just any engineer.

We're looking for that someone special (yes, we're hoping that's you... keep reading to see ).

Someone that shares our same vision. Someone that is willing to join us on our journey to change the way that businesses communicate, market, and sell online. Someone that is process-oriented and driven by seeing customers succeed.

As a young start up (we're just coming up to our one year anniversary), we have tons of amazing users and are adding new great companies every single month.  A wonderful product experience is our primary focus here at Demio... from the customer support, to the onboarding process, to the platform itself, we're working to hard to make it all a delightful experience. While the webinar, web-communication space has been around for a while and continues to grow, we believe that we’re creating an entirely new segment in the market and doing it in a simple way.

Demio is a simple but incredibly powerful webinar platform built for SaaS and Software companies. With our platform, companies can generate leads, filter prospects, perform group demos, engaging sales presentations, integrate with their CRM, view advanced webinar reporting, track conversions, and more. It’s truly unlike any other product in the market. 

Our team is small, but nimble. We love to employ great people, and we're hoping you might be the right addition to our amazing engineering team to join us on our big new initiatives and steps forward!

However, we’re at the point now where we KNOW how pivotal it could be to find the right person to fill that role. We want someone to join our team who is hungry to make an impact, constantly striving to improve, highly responsible for their actions, focused on output and results, and understands that great companies are built one small step at a time.

While we’re currently based in Tampa, FL, our entire team is remote, and we are happy to offer the ability to work remote with our team from ANYWHERE in the world through our systems in Slack (moving to Basecamp soon), Github, and Trello (yes, we use an Agile process). We'll do everything we can to make a stress free, easy to navigate operation inside so your role is just as simple as our platform!

Not only will you be remote, but we will offer a great starting salary while working with a small, agile team that is hungry and eager to make an impact. Your work will never go unnoticed. Your work will ALWAYS make large waves in the company.

By joining now, you’ll be able to get in early on our company (But also the fun challenging product objectives) and help make some of the features/updates that will ultimately shape our product perfectly for our customers.

We have a philosophy for our company that revolves around our team: we ONLY work with A-Players. A-Players, in our opinion, are people who cannot accept anything that is less than great.

You’ll be able to work with a passionate, intelligent, and dedicated group of people that will allow you take your skills to the next level. You’ll always be challenged to be the best that you can be.

But hey, we also like to have fun too ; we understand that building a company is quite the journey, and it can be incredibly hard, so we believe that it’s important to enjoy the moments along the way

Skills and Requirements

What are we looking for from you? Well here’s a short list, but it will always be growing:

▪ Developing scalable and reliable backend applications for our live webinar collaboration platform.

▪ Excellent communication/english skills and ability to work well with remote teams (excellent verbal and written english skills)

▪ Follows coding best practices and develops appropriate testing and deployment scripts.

▪ Monitors and develops standards for platform load/usage with recommendations for improving performance. (nothing is ever “perfect”)

▪ Takes ownership of problems and develops innovative solutions to solving them.

And the languages? 

Well, you should have vast experience with a wide range of different programming languages, but at the same time, you should always be willing to learn & grow more. Our ideal candidate has:

  • At least 5 yrs of PHP experience (Phalcon PHP Framework would be plus, but not required)
  • At least 1 year of React.js experience
  • At least 5 years of JavaScript experience
  • At least 5 years of MySQL experience
  • Experience with Amazon EC2 and Elastic Beanstalk usages is a plus
  • Have handled RESTful API connections and 3rd party API integrations via API
  • Working knowledge of MongoDB, and traditional SQL architectures.

Ok, now I know you're wondering... What's our stack built in? It’s pretty dang robust: 

  • Our Streaming platform is built in ReactJS, NodeJS, Socket.io, MongoDB, and WebRTC.
  • Our User platform is build in PhalconPHP, ReactJS, MySQL and a RESTful architecture.
  • Our iOS Mobile App is built in ReactNative and connects to WebRTC. 

What does the average day look like in Demio? Imagine this: 

Log in to our Slack (may be Basecamp soon) application when you login and high five the team already on ! Our team is all over the world, but we're always working together to innovate and move the company forward. 

Review any development updates in Slack from your teammates on new code development, urgent tickets, new bug fixes, or what's new in the system for that day. Communication is always key here in a fast moving company!

Log into Trello and Github, review the sprint for that week and what the next tickets in that sprint on deck are. You can check in with our Director or Engineering to organize any priorities or make sure that your product story is being done right in regards to long-term scalability. You’ll want to commit those branches to Github and then launch them live on our Staging environment.

Our QA lead can then head over and test the ticket in staging and make sure things are looking good. Move that ticket over, once approved, and we’re on to the next big win!

We're here to help our users as well, so that means sometimes taking a look at customer tickets coming in on priority and get those bug fixes moving quickly. Some days we’ll work on priority bugs and others on new tickets! (Most days a combination of both .)

It'll be important that you keep communication with the team, QA, and support on what’s going on and where!

Then, you can high five your teammates again when you log off and update the team in Slack with your daily update! 

Once a week, we'll review the sprint, goals, and any major issues plus we’ll meet month to look where to improve for better internal systems across the company. And if it’s a Friday, we might pop a few beers together (on Demio) and cheers to a great week!

About Demio

At Demio, we are creating a culture of excitement and growth, driven by results. We believe that day-by-day actions & consistencies create lasting success; it’s the little things that matter. We’re creating the freshest, most innovative ideas for software that helps marketers flourish.

Having the freedom to propose and execute even your most out-there ideas for the company and getting all the support and coaching you need to be your best. All in a fun and positive way.

About the pay for this position:

The salary will be based on experience and your background as a Full Stack. We're looking for the RIGHT person, but we want to make sure you are excited about your paycheck too! Estimated starting pay is between 70 - 90k/year with lots of room to grow!

What to do next:

If this sounds exciting to you, and you think working with an awesome startup company sounds great, let’s talk. Shoot us a reply with #DevelopDemio in your subject line, and we’ll set up an interview.

Here’s what we’ll need in the email:

1. Send over a quick review of work you’ve done or developed with relation to the stack above. Any open source projects including GitHub Repo’s work as well. 

2. A résumé is cool but not necessary, feel free to include any and all recommendations from past colleagues or employeers (LinkedIn works :D )

3. Tell us about you personally, stuff you’re into – what your goals are, where you are in life and where you want to be in life. This may not be your dream job, but who knows maybe we can work together to help it become so!

4. What’s your favorite book?

5. BONUS! Include a video of yourself telling us a little bit about yourself – just post it on Vimeo/YouTube/etc. This will greatly increase your chances of an interview! :)

That’s it! We look forward to meeting you!

JOB PERKS

2 Weeks Paid vacation, Love reading ebooks? (Use our digital library or request new books), Paid Access to Digital Courses for extended training, Free Gym Membership, 1 local Tech Event a month, Working with a truly Mission Driven team motivated by excellence

Apply for this position

Please send us your application to: hiring@Demio.com

We are 2amigos Consulting Group, a team of builders and problem solvers with a core belief in delivering excellence. Our drive for "getting it" ensures we become emotionally invested in our client’s business and each of their projects. This value has bred a company culture of providing solutions and products that exceed expectations every time. The results are always something we and the client are proud of.

We are looking for a new Tech Lead PHP Developer to join our team

As our new team member, you have more than 8 years of professional experience in software development. You are a craftsman developer who is motivated, talented, and committed to the job at hand and the team you work with. You take pride and ownership in your deliverables. Your interactions with both our clients and our team show a positive attitude and a vision of success for the project. You thrive on and enjoy the challenges of each day, and you seek to surround yourself with like-minded people. You are a clear communicator that shares often and well, and you expect the same from those around you.

  • Ensure the features developed by the team are produced to the highest possible quality in the fastest possible time by enforcing usage of proven development processes and flows

  • Continually developed throughout your career
  • Ability to handle/lead multiple projects simultaneously
  • PHP PHP MVC Frameworks (Yii, Symfony, Laravel, etc) Javascript SQL MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, NoSQL, etc. * HTML (5) and CSS (3)

  • Our ideal candidate will have the following characteristics:
  • Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken)

  • Access to training and people that can mentor

items.title: NationBuilder: Front-end Developer
items.content:
Full-time

(New York, NY)

NationBuilder is seeking a visually oriented front-end developer with strong command of HTML, CSS, JavaScript. In collaboration with the design team, you will build, maintain, and improve our online website properties and demonstrate to the world what is possible with NationBuilder.

This is an excellent position for someone who thrives working in creative environments. You should have experience hacking existing frameworks, and have no problem building your own.


NationBuilder offers everyone the technology and community infrastructure to lead people to greatness. Our customers range from political candidates and nonprofits to corporations - anyone building a community of people to make something happen in the world. NationBuilder websites use HTML (extended by Liquid), CSS (extended by SASS) and JavaScript. To learn more about NationBuilder, read our mission, beliefs and values.

The design team is based in Brooklyn, New York, but working remotely is a possibility is required.


We are looking for someone who:

  • Has a strong command of HTML/CSS/SCSS/JavaScript, cross-browser development, and write semantic, scalable code.
  • Has experience building polished, responsive websites and a portfolio to prove it.
  • Is strongly visually oriented and precise in code, communication, and documentation.
  • Is a pragmatic problem solver, knowing how to find the middle ground between "perfect, but takes forever to code" and "fixes it now, but nobody will ever be able to understand what I did."
  • Is a clear and concise communicator with excellent collaboration skills.
  • Is humble, passionate about personal growth, and would rather be "better" than "right."
  • Proactively seeks out feedback and welcomes it as an opportunity to grow.
  • Has a strong work ethic, a quick learner and is willing to work with a fast-paced team.

Job Perks: - Health insurance- Casual work environment- Unlimited vacation days- Unlimited MTA card (if in NYC)- $1,500 yearly conference stipend

Apply: To apply, tell us why you’re interested in this position in 140 characters or less. Most importantly, include links to your portfolio with examples of what you’ve built and your resume by emailing jobs@nationbuilder.com with the subject Frontend developer.

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
Tailwise is an early stage startup with a big mission. We’re looking for a talented, dog loving, full-stack developer to join us on our journey to make Tailwise a dog’s best friend.

*WHO WE ARE*

We have an ambitious goal to revolutionise the way people buy and manage their dogs. We believe that all dogs deserve long, healthy lives in loving homes and we are working hard to make it a reality.
We are building a state of the art platform for dog buyers to find and buy their perfect pet. We support dog owners as they go about raising their new dog and give registered dog breeders and rescues an easy way to verify and manage their customers. We’re also working hard to put an end to inhumane and unethical puppy farming.
We're excited about building a diverse, unique and talented team of fellow dog lovers and would love you to join the team!
Tailwise is a young tech startup looking to grow quickly, if you love dogs this is a huge opportunity to get in on the ground floor, joining two founders who have both come from successful venture-backed startups and are experts in their respective fields.

*ABOUT THE ROLE*

As our first engineer, you will play a key role in the definition of our product and have ownership over the tech and development functions of the business.
You will initially be the sole developer, however, we expect to quickly work with you to add other talented engineers to the team. As a tech company, we firmly believe that our product development team will be the core of our business and want to build the best, most diverse tech team in London.

*KEY SKILLS*
* 4 or more years experience as a full stack developer
* Knowledge of a range of programming languages and frameworks, ideally Django/Python, Java, Javascript or React.
* Solid understanding of cloud hosting, AWS, deployment tools and other common technical infrastructure
* Previous work in an agile / scrum environment
* Be eager to work closely with founders and other team members to help define an early stage product
* A keen eye for testing, performance and tidy code

*WHAT WE CAN OFFER*

* Opportunity to become a key player at a unique, value-driven startup
* Ability to work from home
* Share options in the company
* A great holiday policy
* A future dog-friendly office
* Salary dependent on experience

items.title: Senior Frontend Developer
items.content:
The Role


We are looking to add a full-time, Senior Frontend / JavaScript developer to our PropertyFile team to take ownership of the frontend development and help bring our product to the next level. Together with our team of designers, we need your help to continue improving our user facing platform and give our agents and clients a top-class user experience.


You will help us decide which frontend technologies to use and will become the main source of frontend knowledge for the team.


Being a fully remote team, we encourage active collaboration through Slack and video conferencing in Hangouts, including pair programming, show and tell sessions, sprint demos and retrospectives.



About You


You will be excited by the prospect of working within an agile team delivering a constantly evolving, innovative product and will feel equally comfortable working with other developers as well as with designers and product owners.


You are an experienced frontend developer with strong knowledge of JavaScript frameworks, passionate about writing high quality code and not afraid of experimenting with new technologies when needed.


You have a dedicated and private space to enable home working without interruptions, as well as being able to travel to our office in London once a week.


Ideally, you have access to examples of previous work and you are willing for us to approach your previous employers or clients to request testimonials or references.



What you get from us



  • Competitive salary and benefits.

  • Opportunity to work remotely for most of the week with flexible hours. We`re more interested in high quality code and consistency than a regimented 9 to 5.

  • Direct involvement and the ability to influence the project`s future direction. We are a team; everyone`s opinion is important.



What we need from you



  • Extensive experience developing user facing responsive websites using Bootstrap

  • Excellent knowledge of vanilla JavaScript

  • Experience with JS frameworks, preferably Angular

  • Understanding of web accessibility standards

  • Exposure to frontend automated testing

  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills

  • Excellent time management - we won`t keep prodding you with a stick, but still expect deadlines to be met



This will give you bonus points



  • Frontend performance optimisation

  • Experience developing mobile apps

  • Experience with Google Analytics tracking

items.title: Alt & Dot: Front End Developer - Shopify
items.content:
Front End Developer - Shopify

Posted Oct 30

Alt & Dot
Headquarters: Brooklyn, NY
altanddot.workable.com

Hi there! We’re looking for a Front End Shopify Developer to join the Alt & Dot team. Want to watch your code directly impact a merchant’s sales and conversions? Enjoy bringing designs to life with pixel perfect code and carefully crafted liquid snippets? Read on.

About You

You love code. You enjoy transforming ideas into pragmatic code. You take pride in shipping code that is concise, readable, and standards-compliant.

You love great UX. While you spend most of your time developing, you know your work is about more than the code. You keep the user experience in mind with an eye for design and empathy for the end user.

You love learning new things. You’re excited by new technology and love that your work affords the opportunity for continuous learning. You’re always eager to explore a new language or framework, or to pick up a new hobby outside of the office.

You love helping others. You’re an excellent (and patient) communicator, keen to share your knowledge and put your expertise to use to help teammates, clients, and the community at large.


About Alt & Dot

Operating with Canadian politeness, a New York work ethic, and a splash of California fun, we’re  a small remote team crafting Shopify solutions for ecommerce merchants.

Founded in NYC by a Canadian developer and a Californian designer, we believe the client relationship should be about more than just pixels and code. We pride ourselves on partnering with clients to deliver solutions that solve actual problems, create real opportunities, and bring true value to their businesses.

We offer strategy, design, and development services and enjoy collaborative, ongoing relationships with our clients. We grow by helping them grow.

We're excited to work with talented and empathetic people no matter their race, religion, nationality, sex, physical or mental disability, or age. We believe, when we work together with different views, experiences, and ideas, we can do amazing things.

Our team is fully remote and stays in touch primarily via Slack and weekly stands-ups over Zoom.


About the Role

This is a contract-to-hire position, hours are flexible.

Things you’ll do...
  • Empower clients to grow their businesses through thoughtful implementation
  • Develop new ecommerce websites on the Shopify platform
  • Implement new features or help improve UI/UX on existing shops
  • Collaborate with the team to transform requirements into robust solutions
  • Bring mockups and designs to life with pixel perfect implementation
  • Optimize sites for desktop, mobile and various browsers

You’ll succeed with...
  • Native-level English fluency
  • 2+ years experience in Shopify web development
  • Required Expertise: Liquid, HTML, CSS, jQuery, Javascript
  • Preferred Expertise: AJAX, JSON, Ruby on Rails, Node.js
  • Demonstrated ability to transform designs into pixel perfect code
  • An understanding of cross-browser compatibility and responsive design
  • Ability to self-manage with excellent time management and communication skills

You’ll excel with...
  • Knowledge of Git or other version control systems
  • Familiarity with performance optimization and SEO
  • Experience with Shopify API and SDKs


How to Apply

Apply directly via the link below. We’ve included a few questions that we would normally ask at the start of an interview. This helps us get to know you a bit better and expedite the interview process. Be sure to answer each question for your application to be considered. Creativity in your application is both welcome and encouraged. :)

Apply for this position

https://altanddot.workable.com/j/906F8B3228

items.title: Front end Developer
items.content:
OPPORTUNITY


You’ll be a part of an innovative high-tech startup with a passionate and exceptionally talented team, building the front end web application for Dropsource. Our team works agile and truly values individuals over processes. Our approach yields high quality features, but we are not afraid to step out of that methodology when we think it makes sense.


WHAT YOU’LL DO


As a Front-End Developer at Dropsource you will help analyze and develop new features for the front-end of our web application. You will be expected to collaborate with designers, developers and QA to ensure we are efficiently shipping product.


Your responsibilities will include:



  • Implement new features using React JS, HTML, and CSS

  • Write unit tests for newly developed features

  • Refactoring existing code where necessary to keep our codebase up to date and best practice

  • Work with designers to analyze and validate new features before they are built. This will include analyzing UI/UX designs to give feedback on technical feasibility as well as helping to build functional prototypes

  • Engage with QA team to debug and resolve issues

  • Implement analytics to track user actions and behaviors within the product

  • Track metrics for new features deployed to production to ensure they meet performance and usability requirements


REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS


The ideal candidate will meet the following requirements:


Must have:



  • Experience working in an agile team

  • Extensive experience with at least one major JavaScript framework (Angular, React, Ember, etc.)

  • Knowledge of modern HTML, CSS, and JavaScript patterns

  • Experience working with designers, testers and other developers

  • Experience writing JavaScript unit tests

  • Basic knowledge of good UX patterns

  • Solid understanding of data structures

  • Bachelor of Science degree in a STEM field + 3 years of experience building complex applications for the web. Or equivalent experience


Nice to have:



  • Contributions to open source projects

  • Have an online presence (personal website, blog, portfolio, etc.)

  • Experience with React, ES6, Gulp, Webpack, SASS, Mocha

  • Experience working with a server-side technology like Node.js, Scala

  • Experience with CSS animations

  • Familiar with the design philosophy and constraints of mobile platform app development


DROPSOURCE OFFERS


Dropsource is headquartered in downtown Raleigh, NC and offers flexible office hours, telecommuting options, competitive salaries and benefits and equity participation.


DROPSOURCE (QUEUE SOFTWARE INC.) IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER


**US-based candidates only please**

20d

items.title: Senior Front End/ Full Stack Developer
items.content:
About you

If you care about software quality but find testing and QA boring, maybe you are curious whether there might be a better way?
Do you love building new stuff, learning and working with emerging technologies? Working with a team of skilled engineers with the same passion as yours and a desire to build unique and groundbreaking products?
If so, we would like to hear from you.


About us

We are SpotQA's Product Team, building the next generation of test automation software.
We are building the self-driving car technology for the testing world.
Our objective? To develop new technology that uses machine-learning and domain expertise with the aim of performing testing fully autonomously
To help with our mission, we are looking for a Senior Front End Developer (or a full-stack engineer who has a passion for frontend) to join our team. Ideally, the following characteristics resonate with you:
A CODER WITH AN EYE FOR DESIGN - Code and test technical solutions working closely with our UI / UX designer and development teams
A QUALITY AMBASSADOR - You passionately care about applying best practices and adhering to coding, performance and usability standards
A TEAM LEADER - You are self-driven and want to take an active role to help lead frontend directions of SpotQA



REQUIREMENTS

Most importantly, we are looking for can-do attitudes, a passion to learn/grow independently and willingness to delve into problems.
We also have our eyes on a few skills, namely expertise/strong experience in the following:
Strong Javascript (preferably ES6), HTML5 and CSS3 skills
Strong communication skills along with excellent problem solving / analytical skills
Responsive design expertise, and ability to create cross-browser/cross-device friendly solutions
Willing and able to constantly learn and keep up with the latest and greatest development technologies
Following engineering best practices (e.g., use version control, create tests, use IDEs, debuggers and profilers)
MV* frameworks, (e.g., Vue.js, React.js), as well as Flux-based architectures (e.g., VueX, Redux)



BENEFITS

Competitive Salary.
Possibility of working remotely is available.
Personal development by working with a fast growing multinational startup aiming to shape the future of Digital QA.

items.title: Ben Loop: JavaScript & React Programmer
items.content:
JavaScript & React Programmer

Posted Oct 25

Ben Loop
Headquarters: Ostrava, Czech Republic
https://benloop.com

Who we are

In Ben Loop we are developing custom-made mobile and web applications. We focus on long-term cooperation in projects and we collaborate with clients from around the globe. Besides the Czech Republic, they are from Spain, Germany and USA at the moment.

Our clients include advanced start-ups as well as bigger and well-established companies and their internal start-ups.

  

What will your working day look like

Ben Loop was founded by two freelancers and, perhaps, that’s why we put great emphasis on personal freedom.

You can start when you want in the morning and decide yourself where you’re going to work. We usually work remotely in Ben Loop, but there are certain periods when we gladly go to our office in Ostrava, Czech Republic.

First thing in the morning we have a stand-up via Slack. The stand-up time may vary and is always arranged by mutual agreement. Some prefer starting early, others work better later.

We usually discuss the previous day’s issues as well as tasks for the current day at the stand-up.

Everyone then works on their assignments during the day and any other potential communication is carried on via Basecamp/Github/Slack. Nobody checks anybody as for when and how they work – only the results are important.

During the day and at the end of it, we commit the work in a standard way to Github where another developer always performs Code Review for you after you complete a task.

We usually work in this way for our clients 4 days a week, the fifth day is dedicated to education, open source or other development activities we don’t have time for during the week.

  
Who we are looking for

We are looking for developers for long-term cooperation from Europe who have experience with Javascript & React, enjoy working on frontend and have active open source profile. We don’t mind if you have contributions to another project or you have your own open projects and apps, but visible activity on Github, for at least several past months, is important for us.

Another important thing for us is the ability to learn new things, open-mindedness, a common touch and the ability to deal with problems independently.

  
What we can gradually offer to you

Not just any degree of freedom
Remote work and flexible working hours (please read – you work no more than 8 hours, when you decide, not from sun to sun).

Extra holiday
Everybody in Ben Loop can take as much paid holiday as they want. We consider rest as an inseparable part of work and therefore we don’t prevent anybody from taking time off when it’s needed.

New hardware on a regular basis
Everyone gets a new MacBook and iPhone or an Android phone (of your choice) every two or three years.

A load of other benefits
Everyone in Ben Loop can choose other benefits which suit them best. The standard ones include sport, massage or education benefits, holiday allowance and more.

Apply for this position

To apply for this position please send a short summarization of your work experience to daniel@benloop.com. Please don’t send us a typical CV, nobody will read it. Also open source activity or open projects are required for this positions, so don’t forget to add a link to your Github profile. We accept only the applicants who live in the Europe. Please add “55” at the end of the subject of your email - we will ignore all other emails without it.

items.title: Senior Engineer / Architect ReactJS @ Modus Create
items.content:
Senior Engineer / Architect ReactJS @ Modus Create

2017-10-24 19:17

Description

In this role you will be converting a PHP monolithic app to an API Microservices architecture app using ReactJS, Redux, Node, GraphQL and MySQL.

You are a forward thinking, creative problem solver with a passion for core JavaScript. If you’ve got the chops and want to ditch the cubicle, apply to the best lean startup development team on the planet. At Modus Create you will collaborate with a cross-functional Scrum team to deliver high quality innovative products in short sprint cycles. This contract role may be performed from a remote location and requires a level of effort estimated at 40 hours per week.

You must be willing to support all of business hours of our client located in Central Time Zone of the United States. Preference will be given to candidates closely aligned with this time zone.

Responsibilities

  • Write lots of quality, high performing JavaScript code
  • Architecture and development of the web apps in ReactJS, Redux
  • Collaborate daily with UX, Engineering, QA and DevOps to deliver functionality for a highly visible web app for a leading educational services company
  • Consult to our end client regarding development best practices

Required Skills and Experience

  • Experience delivering high value, heavy UI front-end products
  • Good understanding of front-end MVC architectures
  • Strong experience with ReactJS and Redux
  • Strong Javascript basis and very good understand of the JS core (ES6/7)
  • Strong experience with GraphQL
  • Good understanding of PHP is a strong plus
  • Good understanding of HTML5 and CSS3
  • Experience with at least one of the SCSS compilers: Sass or Less
  • Experience in following Agile/Scrum SDLC
  • Be comfortable communicating in a virtual environment* A consistent, reliable internet connection

Let’s Talk about You

You value outcomes above all else: You have a proven track record shipping great mobile and web products. By understanding the big picture, you articulate strategy and vision with strong written and verbal communication.

You Lead by Doing: You realize that the big picture is worthless without getting your hands dirty in the technical details for strategic and tactical problem solving. You understand the value of situational leadership and can adapt to the needs and strength of your team.

You Love Work, Growth and Learning: You dream of working in a culture that values hard work, continued learning and innovation with a commitment to building amazing products for clients and their end users. You’ll stop learning when you are dead, and until then you desire to gain deeper knowledge in technology and business.

Let’s Talk About Us

Modus Create is a Product Studio offering consulting services and SaaS products for strategic planning, design and execution of web-based and mobile products. We work across multiple industries with Fortune 1000, ISVs, and startups to validate, plan and launch new products. Headquartered in Reston, VA, we are a bootstrapped team that has grown from 2 to 100 people in 26 countries in 6 years, committed to building the best product consulting firm on the planet. We offer a highly collaborative, autonomous and effective working environment. We love and believe in what we do. This is your chance to be part of building something great.

Why Modus Create

  • Competitive compensation
  • Ability to work remotely / telecommute
  • Working side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech

Do you have what it takes to join the DC area's most awesome tech company? Let’s start a conversation.

Country

Anywhere*

Location

You must be willing to support all of business hours of our client located in Central Time Zone of the United States. Preference will be given to candidates closely aligned with this time zone.

items.title: Senior Front-End Engineer, JavaScript + .NET @ Olo
items.content:
Senior Front-End Engineer, JavaScript + .NET @ Olo

2017-10-21 13:05

Description

Department: Engineering

Location: (Multiple States)

Type: Full Time

At Olo we develop an online food ordering platform used by many of the country’s largest restaurant chains, reaching millions of consumers. We take pride in a neat codebase with automated tests and continuous integration, and encourage constant refactoring. We encourage new ideas and experimentation. No part of the code base is off limits.

Our current technologies include modern versions of Ember, React, TypeScript, ASP.NET MVC, C#, and F#. We also rely on tools such as AWS, GitHub, TeamCity, Octopus Deploy, Sumo Logic, Datadog, and New Relic. We don’t expect you to have experience with everything in this list, and we’ll help you learn what you don’t know!

As a front-end engineer at Olo, you will play a significant and visible role in helping us build one of the most advanced food ordering platforms in the hospitality industry. You will help us shape the digital guest experience for restaurant brands served by Olo. You will contribute to technology selection, architecture and user experience for our front-end applications.

Any engineer may work at Olo’s headquarters in New York City’s Financial District or remotely from anywhere in the U.S. In fact, more than half of our engineering team is remote!

Requirements

  • Experience building user interfaces that put users first and look and feel awesome to use
  • Deep knowledge of ES6/ES2015+ and one or more modern Javascript frameworks, with a preference for React or Ember
  • Demonstrable understanding of the full .NET web stack
  • Leadership experience that spans one or more aspects of technology selection, architecture and design oversight, and mentoring others
  • Superb problem solving skills with an emphasis on pragmatism, quality, and performance
  • Passion for learning new skills and technologies
  • Excellent collaboration skills
  • BS degree in a technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience
  • Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English
  • Legal right to work in the U.S.

About Olo

Olo reaches millions of consumers by powering mobile and online ordering for many of the country’s largest restaurant chains. Mobile ordering and payments is an exciting and active industry full of interesting players and yet still a relatively untapped market ripe for disruption.

We’re quite up-front about the technical challenges our business faces. Running a platform with multiple white-labeled front-ends, that maintains real-time connections into thousands of restaurants’ POS systems, and coordinates complex transactions between these and other third parties (such as payment gateways and gift card providers) is not for the faint of heart!

Olo is located at 26 Broadway in the historic Standard Oil Building, the former home of John D. Rockefeller. We offer great benefits, such as 20 days of Paid Time Off, fully paid health, dental and vision care premiums, stock options, a generous parental leave plan, and perks like FitBits, rotating craft beers on tap in our kitchen, and food events featuring our clients' menu items (now you know why we give out FitBits!). Check out our culture map.

Olo is an equal opportunity employer and diversity is valued at our company. All applicants receive consideration for employment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Country

United States
